explanation: Agent A is correct. With #define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) the OS_DEBUG(...) invocation in the function preprocesses to nothing (leaving an empty/null statement) and the strerror(ret) argument is not evaluated. The statement therefore has no runtime effect in this build; removing it would not change program behaviour. Per MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 (“Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code”), this is dead code in the given build configuration. (If OS_DEBUG were defined to perform logging, then the call would not be dead.)
